title: Evening showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North-western and Northern provinces and in Galle and Matara districts after 2.00 p.m. today (21).

title: Sri Lanka–Indonesia discuss integrating EVs into Sri Lanka’s public transport system
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has met with Dewi Gustina Tobing, the Ambassador of to Sri Lanka, at the Parliament complex to discuss areas of collaboration between the two nations.

title: 24-year-old woman arrested over Nagalagam Street shooting
byline: A 24-year-old woman has been arrested in connection with the shooting incident that occurred on March 17 in the Nagalagam Street area, in the Grandpass Police Division.

title: Sri Lanka cannot abandon IMF framework, must strengthen foreign ties – Ranil
byline: Sri Lanka must embrace rapid economic growth and bold reforms to secure its future, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe asserted, warning that the country cannot afford to remain stagnant.

title: SLAF training aircraft crashes in Wariyapola
byline: A training aircraft of the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) has crashed in the Wariyapola area, according to the SLAF Spokesman.

title: Application called for appointing member to RTI commission
byline: Applications have been called for the appointment of a member to the Right to Information (RTI) Commission.

title: Trump signs order aimed at dismantling US Department of Education
byline: Flanked by students and educators, U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday signed an executive order intended to essentially dismantle the federal Department of Education, making good on a longstanding campaign promise to conservatives.

title: Tense situation during protest near Parliament Roundabout
byline: A tense situation has been reported at Polduwa Junction, near the Parliament Roundabout, where protesting unemployed graduates are facing off with the police, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: CID raises new suspicion over Piumi Hansamali’s cosmetics business
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has directed the Illegal Assets Investigation Unit of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to further investigate Piumi Hansamali under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act and report progress to the court.

title: Six CCD officers surrender in connection with Weligama shooting incident
byline: The six officers of the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) charged in connection with the shooting incident at a hotel in Weligama, Matara, have surrendered to the Matara Magistrate’s Court today (21) through a motion.

title: World Indoor Athletics Championship: Sri Lanka’s Chamod Yodhasinghe qualifies for semifinals
byline: Sri Lanka’s Chamod Yodhasinghe has qualified for the Men’s 60m semi-finals at the World Indoor Athletics Championship being held in Nanjing, China.

title: Heathrow Airport closes for the day after a fire knocks out power, disrupting hundreds of flights
byline: Britain’s Heathrow Airport was closed for the day Friday after a fire knocked out its power, disrupting flights for hundreds of thousands of passengers at Europe’s busiest travel hub.

title: Sri Lankan Airlines’ flights to London cancelled
byline: Sri Lankan Airlines has cancelled several flights to London scheduled to depart Colombo today, due to the temporary closure of Heathrow Airport in London following a large fire at a nearby electrical substation.

title: Mariah Carey didn’t steal ‘All I Want For Christmas Is You’ from other writers, a judge says
byline: A federal judge in Los Angeles has ruled that Mariah Carey did not steal her perennial megahit “All I Want for Christmas Is You” from other songwriters.

title: ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder: Evidence uncovered against arrested cops, all suspects further remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered ten suspects arrested in connection with the shooting and killing of the notorious criminal figure and drug trafficker Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa” to be remanded further until April 04.

title: Sri Lanka’s deflation drops marginally in February 2025
byline: The overall rate of inflation as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) on Y-o-Y basis increased to -3.9 % in February 2025, compared to -4.0% in January 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Court rules against K-pop group NewJeans in record label dispute
byline: A South Korean court has ruled against chart-topping K-pop group NewJeans which had sought to cut ties with its record label Ador.

title: Over 400 nominations for LG Election rejected
byline: The Commissioner General of Elections, Saman Sri Ratnayake, says that the nominations process for the 2025 Local Government Elections was conducted across 25 districts from March 17 to 12 noon yesterday (20).
